definition: to be the reason why somebody does something or behaves in a particular way
to make somebody want to do something, especially something that involves hard work and effort
to give reasons for something that you have stated
a musical instrument with metal strings (usually eight) arranged in pairs, and a curved back, played with a plectrum
a university teacher of the highest rank
a teacher at a university or college
the result when you multiply a whole number by all the numbers below it
to reduce the speed at which a vehicle is travelling
to become or make something become slower
to happen faster or earlier; to make something happen faster or earlier
to start to go faster
a piece of equipment for taking photographs, moving pictures or television pictures. It can be a separate item or part of another device.
in a judge’s private room, without the press or the public being present
without a camera recording what is happening
while a camera is recording what is happening
a special event that people organize in order to celebrate something
the act of celebrating something
a pen with a very small metal ball at its point, that rolls ink (= coloured liquid for writing, etc.) onto the paper
thick and sticky; not flowing freely
hard; not in the form of a liquid or gas
having no holes or spaces inside; not hollow
without spaces; continuous
made completely of the material mentioned (that is, the material is not only on the surface)
strong and made well
that you can rely on; having a strong basis
definitely good and steady but perhaps not excellent or special
without a break; continuous
of the colour mentioned and no other colour
a shape that is solid has length, width and height and is not flat
in complete agreement; agreed on by everyone
to be in a strong position in an argument, etc. because you know the facts
a type of heavy oil used as a fuel instead of petrol
a vehicle that uses diesel fuel
a quicker or shorter way of getting to a place
a way of doing something that is quicker than the usual way
a record of the address of a file, website, or other data that is made so you can access the file, etc. quickly

a word or phrase used to describe somebody/something else, in a way that is different from its normal use, in order to show that the two things have the same qualities and to make the description more powerful, for example She has a heart of stone; the use of such words and phrases
a sign that shows that something is going to happen soon, often something bad
to add to something in a way that improves it or makes it more attractive
a thing that is added to something else to improve or complete it
an extra separate section, often in the form of a magazine, that is sold with a newspaper
a book or a section at the end of a book that gives extra information or deals with a special subject
an amount of money that you pay for an extra service or item, especially in addition to the basic cost of a holiday
easy to use or to do
located near to somebody/something; located or stored in a convenient place
able to use your hands or tools to make or repair things well
to be useful
possible to deal with or control
feeling happy about something
happy or willing to do something
not pleased; angry
very happy or willing to do something
very pleased/proud
too proud of something you have done
the glass part that fits into an electric lamp, etc. to give light when it is switched on
the round underground part of some plants, like an onion in shape, that grows into a new plant every year
an object that is like a bulb in shape, for example the end of a thermometer
a small piece of advice about something practical
a secret or expert piece of advice about what the result of a competition, etc. is likely to be, especially about which horse is likely to win a race
secret information that somebody gives, for example to the police, to warn them about an illegal activity that is going to happen or has happened
a small amount of extra money that you give to somebody, for example somebody who serves you in a restaurant
the thin, pointed end of something
a small part that fits on or over the end of something
a place where you can take rubbish and leave it
an untidy place
if a word or name is on the tip of your tongue, you are sure that you know it but you cannot remember it
only a small part of a much larger problem
becoming angry very easily
easily made angry
getting annoyed easily; showing your anger
traditional Japanese theatre, in which songs, dance and mime are performed by men
a sport in which two people fight and try to throw each other to the ground
only; single
belonging to one person or group; not shared
an instrument for measuring the speed of the wind or of a current of gas
an official working in an organization or a government department, especially one who follows the rules of the department too strictly
the feeling of being sad because something has not happened or been as good, successful, etc. as you expected or hoped
a person or thing that is disappointing
a person whose job is to take care of sheep
an animal of the camel family, with only one hump, that lives in desert countries
a disease, especially of children, that causes painful swellings at the sides of the face and under the ears
a person whose job involves travelling and working in a spacecraft
an astronaut from the former Soviet Union
a man who travels into space; an astronaut
(in stories) a creature that visits the earth from another planet
a musical instrument played especially in Scotland. The player blows air into a bag held under the arm and then slowly forces the air out through pipes to produce a noise.
not what somebody claims it is; false or pretended
a person who behaves, dresses, etc. like somebody famous because they want to be like them
used to describe somebody who is hoping to become the type of person mentioned
a type of small horse
an event that is planned only in order to impress people so that they will support or buy something
walking, rather than travelling by car, bus, etc.
a bunch of hair tied at the back of the head so that it hangs like a horse’s tail
liberal opinions and beliefs, especially in politics
a person who believes that laws and governments are not necessary
having no government, order or control
connected with communism
governed by or belonging to a Communist party
a large fish that has silver skin and is pink inside and is used for food. Salmon live in the sea but swim up rivers to lay their eggs.
the soft substance between the skin and bones of animal or human bodies
the skin of the human body
the soft part of fruit and vegetables, especially when it is eaten
the human body when considering its physical and sexual needs, rather than the mind or soul
when you say that somebody is flesh and blood, you mean that they are a normal human with needs, emotions and weaknesses
a person that you are related to
to die
if you see somebody in the flesh, you are in the same place as them and actually see them rather than just seeing a picture of them
to make you feel afraid or full of horror
the full amount that somebody owes you, even if this will cause them trouble or difficulty
to say hello to people by shaking hands
to develop a basic idea, etc. by giving more details to make it more complete
you intend to do good things but you are too lazy, weak or busy to actually do them
a person or thing that repeatedly annoys somebody or stops them from doing something
a weapon with a long wooden handle and a sharp metal point used for fighting, hunting and fishing in the past
the long pointed stem of some plants
used to refer to a thing whose name you do not know or have forgotten, or which you do not want to mention
unnecessary or more than you need or want
to agree to do something that you have been refusing to do for a long time
to stop resisting an enemy and accept that you are defeated
a pub, usually in the country and often one where people can stay the night
a small hotel, usually in the country
used in the names of many pubs, hotels and restaurants
a word or group of words, such as in, from, to, out of and on behalf of, used before a noun or pronoun to show place, position, time or method
a word that is used instead of a noun or noun phrase, for example he, it, hers, me, them, etc.
a chart showing the times at which trains, buses and planes leave and arrive
a chart or plan of the classes that a student or teacher has in school each week
a plan of when you expect or hope particular events to happen
a plan that lists all the work that you have to do and when you must do each thing
a chart showing the times at which trains, buses and planes leave and arrive
a chart or plan of the classes that a student or teacher has in school each week
a list of the television and radio programmes that are on a particular channel and the times that they start
a written list of things, for example prices, rates or conditions
